ygData.subject: Re: Patch Update today
ygData.msgSnippet: No - this is not the reason.  I never use Accelerando while fighting - I tested it right after the patch was put in.  It NEVER broke root. It seems to me one
ygData.messageBody:
No - this is not the reason. I never use Accelerando while fighting - I
tested it right after the patch was put in. It NEVER broke root.

It seems to me one of three things has happened:

1) They have changed it since the patch first appeared (I haven't been
trying it under the assumption it does nothing)
2) Level is a factor - and never kicked in for me when I tested it.
3) The Root duration is pretty random anyway - perhaps the people when
people thought they "broke" it - it simply wore off at the same time.

Slyde

----- Original Message -----
From: Steven S. Klug <sklug@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 28, 1999 12:28 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Patch Update today


> From: "Steven S. Klug" <sklug@...>
>
> Perhaps it has to do with whether Accelerando is currently up at the time.
> Maybe if you have it up when you get rooted, you can't break it with
accel,
> but if you aren't singing it when you're rooted, it will break it. It
> wouldn't be too far fetched considering the weirdness involved with these
> interactions we've seen in the past.
>
> Laluni Songhammer, 27th level bard of E'Ci (who hasn't been fighting mobs
> that root recently)
>
